dmca.title: inmyfinger.com - splog and possible copyright violations
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the
Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your
claim.

Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal.
 
Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.

-----Original Message-----
From: static@protectedstatic.com [mailto:static@protectedstatic.com] 
Posted At: Saturday, April 29, 2006 1:18 AM
Posted To: Copyright
Conversation: inmyfinger.com - splog and possible copyright violations
Subject: inmyfinger.com - splog and possible copyright violations


The Planet -- Checking technorati this evening, I found that
inmyfinger.com, a site that you host, has harvested one of my blog
postings in order to boost their "Google juice" to advertise Christian
dating services. The site in question may be found here:
http://blogger.inmyfinger.com/blogs/christian-meet-online-woman/18585/

My original post may be found here:
http://protectedstatic.blogspot.com/2006/04/randompolitics-atheism-and-c
ompassion.html

I do not like seeing my work used for commercial purposes without my
explicit permission - or compensation. I'm willing to bet that there are
plenty of other copyright holders who would feel the same way about
their work being harvested so that this spam blog (splog) can boost its
Google ratings for "Christian meet online woman". There is not a single
piece of content on that site (that I saw) that hasn't been harvested
from somewhere else. The entire site looks like one big copyright
violation.

I honestly don't know if this customer's behavior reaches the threshold
specified by the DMCA, but I do know that I do not like seeing my
original content used in this exploitive manner. Thank you for your
attention to this matter.

-- Carter Wickstrom, aka "protected static"
   Seattle, WA
   http://www.protectedstatic.com/
